item.title: Bob add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "Great things are not accomplished by those who yield to trends and fads and popular opinion." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Bob add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "Boys and girls in America have such a sad time together; sophistication demands that they submit to sex immediately without proper preliminary talk. Not courting talk — real straight talk about souls, for life is holy and every moment is precious." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Bob add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "There is no trap so deadly as the trap you set for yourself." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: Bob add a quote by Dashiell Hammett
item.description: "The problem with putting two and two together is that sometimes you get four, and sometimes you get twenty-two." -- Dashiell Hammett

item.title: Bob add a quote by Ian Fleming
item.description: "You only live twice: Once when you're born And once when you look death in the face." -- Ian Fleming

item.title: Bob add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Bob add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description:
"down these mean streets a man must go who is not himself mean, who is neither tarnished nor afraid. He is the hero; he is everything. He must be a complete man and a common man and yet an unusual man. He must be, to use a rather weathered phrase, a man of honor—by instinct, by inevitability, without thought of it, and certainly without saying it. He must be the best man in his world and a good enough man for any world.
“He will take no man’s money dishonestly and no man’s insolence without a due and dispassionate revenge. He is a lonely man and his pride is that you will treat him as a proud man or be very sorry you ever saw him.
“The story is this man’s adventure in search of a hidden truth, and it would be no adventure if it did not happen to a man fit for adventure. If there were enough like him, the world would be a very safe place to live in, without becoming too dull to be worth living in." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: Bob add a quote by John Updike
item.description: "Dreams come true. Without that possibility, nature would not incite us to have them. " -- John Updike

item.title: Bob add a quote by John Updike
item.description: "Suspect each moment, for it is a thief, tiptoeing away with more than it brings." -- John Updike

item.title: Bob add a quote by John Updike
item.description: "What art offers is space – a certain breathing room for the spirit." -- John Updike

item.title: Bob add a quote by John Updike
item.description: "Any activity becomes creative when the doer cares about doing it right, or better." -- John Updike

item.title: Bob add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "Sex is one of the nine reasons for reincarnation. The other eight are unimportant" -- Henry Miller

item.title: Bob add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "All that I hope to say in books, all that I ever hope to say, is that I love the world." -- E.B. White

item.title: Bob add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "You can't beat women anyhow and that if you are wise or dislike trouble and uproar you don't even try to." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Bob add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Never be afraid to raise your voice for honesty and truth and compassion against injustice and lying and greed. If people all over the world...would do this, it would change the earth." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Bob add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Bob add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Bob add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Bob add a quote by H.P. Lovecraft
item.description: "Pleasure to me is wonder—the unexplored, the unexpected, the thing that is hidden and the changeless thing that lurks behind superficial mutability." -- H.P. Lovecraft

item.title: Bob add a quote by Stephen Hawking
item.description: "We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the Universe. That makes us something very special." -- Stephen Hawking
